intro: Columnea umbellata, commonly known as the umbellate flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its stems are often covered in fine, soft hairs. Columnea umbellata is popular in horticulture for its vibrant blooms and is often cultivated as a decorative plant in shaded gardens.
